adjective.description: Having a meaning that is mysterious or obscure.
examples: he found his boss's utterances too cryptic

adjective.description: (of coloration or markings) serving to camouflage an animal in its natural environment.

origin: Early 17th century: from late Latin crypticus, from Greek kruptikos, from kruptos hidden. cryptic (sense 2) dates from the late 19th century.
